posts.title: Autobiography: A Work Of Fiction
posts.body:
Prologue

------------------------------------------------

It started out, like many good stories begin, with another boring day at some lousy nine-to-five. But it wasn't any boring day. For one because it was night, but that's beside the point. I was on my way out of the building to do my usual cigarette break while  waiting on that damn mail server to boot up. I passed Dominica, the haggard old janitor from south the rio grande. She said hello and I offered some token hand gesture of acknowledgement to that regard. Exiting the building, I pulled out my pack of Lucky Strikes. The good ones. Not the ones I had been saving for a special occasion, but the really good ones. And that's when I noticed something was off. The nicotine hit harder than it should have. Way harder. These weren't my good cigarettes, they were my PCP cigarettes!

I began to question my decision not to label the pack laced with mind-altering narcotics when I was struck with an even bigger question. Why the hell did I have those with me? Was it because I always carry a pack of PCP laced cigarettes on my person? No, that's exactly what they want me to think. Clearly this was planned. The KGB was hatching an elaborate conspiracy against me, and there was only one way to stop them!

On my way back in I saw Dominica, and she made some offhanded comment about how I didn't look so good. Damn! Those bastards got to Dominica, too? Or was she always one of them?

"¿Señor? Are you okay? You do not look so good..."

"LIES!" I shouted at the top of my lungs, "Slander and lies! I- Wait a minute. If you're Mexican why the hell are you speaking English?"

She seemed genuinely confused. A good act, but I wasn't having it.

"Que?"

"It's too late for that!" I roared as I let my left hook fly.

I tasted the blood before I felt my fist making contact. Which was weird, because I know for a fact commies don't bleed. It could only mean a second party was conspiring against me!

"Who are you working for?!"

"United Custodial!" She wailed between sobbing, "Please don't hurt me! Have family!"

"Of course. How could I have been so blind?"  

It all made sense. My eyes were open to the truth, and I had no intention of blinking.

"You aren't a Soviet spy... You're a Nazi!"


Chapter One - Dial 666 For Satan


So, I'm a drug lord, now.

It was this whole mob thing, you know how it goes. I found a little bit of maybe a few hundred keys of coke inside some greaseball's apartment, he comes home, trips over his dead wife, and all of a sudden he falls on all the bullets coming out of my gun. And I guess a lot of it can be absorbed through the skin, because I don't know WHEN I stole that boat, but it is wasted, I mean just absolutely trashed. I just abandoned it on the beach. Million dollar yacht, and it's absolutely destroyed.

Oh, right, so, I didn't, y'know, show up unannounced to a foreign country and suddenly become the cartel or anything. First thing I did was to swing a rusty pipe I found, and sure enough, here's some dude talking on an iPhone, and wouldn't you know it, he just walks right into the pipe I totally wasn't swinging at him. I tried apologizing, but he seemed pretty out of it; I don't know, he was probably some junkie. But. on the up-side, guess who found a free iPhone nearby? I know there's a lot of iPhone hate, but to be fair, you have no idea how many "lost flip phones" I had to find before that point. Not one of them had internet access. Punk ass bitches.

So, because I'm not an idiot, I bribe the little aztec dude at the supermarket with a gram of coke in exchange for looking the other way while one of those prepaid mobile cards went missing. Naturally, they all went missing, along with the cash in the register, seventy five boxes of Chocodiles, plus all of the tequila, NyQuil, and outdated hustler magazines they had. Also, wouldn't you know it, he also ran into my rusty pipe while he was off in the water-closet frosting the tips of his mustache. Coincidentally, I found about two lines short of a gram of cocaine, plus the keys to the back, and even some free surveillance footage tapes. How lucky am I, right?

It was around sundown when I got to the end of what has to have been hands down the longest two miles of dirt road in the history of ever. It was some hill overlooking a small town, but they had power lines running through the jungle, so I guess I shouldn't have been taken aback to find the dingy little motel offering insanely overpriced wifi on what has to be hands down the slowest internet connection in the entire world.

Now, I figured I'd need some help if I was going to evade INTERPOL and their robot kill-hounds so I tried to find some of my Colombian relatives on social media now that I had a new iPhone. And since I was using an iPhone on ass-slow internet speeds I would use the platform designed for ass-slow old people! Facebook! So, I got in contact with one of them, figuring at least a city councellor might know a decent place for me to lay low for a while. Except I can't explain that I'm on the run from the mafia, or that I've got a duffel bag filled with cocaine, or that I'm even trying to blend. And that was my first mistake. Turns out I underestimated the whole, family super-bond thing, because instead of helping me rent a low-key appartment, I found myself in the one place most likely to draw attention to me. The home of an ambitious senator living in Cartagena.

So, pretty much the first day I'm there, Carlos, we'll call him, introduces me to his family. It's him, his wife, and his three kids. The wife is okay, beter looking than most women her age in this hellhole. Though, judging by the size of their home I came to the conclusion that he was doing quite well for the supposedly cleanest running candidate. She's also a livid drunk, and a lot more fun after the sun goes down and the glasses stack up. Makes sense; being forced to keep up appearances in public must get stressful when you've got an entire city's eyes on your husband's career. The twins, identical, both not too bad, in their own right, were about fifteen or so, and were apparently football stars. It'd take a while before I learned that meant soccer, here.

Columbia is weird.

---

"Up. Get up."

... Nnnghhh.

"La cocaina. Show it to me, now."

It was an unusual way to be awakened at three in the morning, but I have to give it to the man for bringing the machette. And the backup pistol.

"How the hell did you know?"

He laughed and lowered the revolver. Severely confused, I raised an eyebrow.

"Pinche, gringo. You show up in my country unannounced, with no luggage, wearing the clothes of a... how you say, douchebag? A... Ah... What is phrase? Acting like a total Andy Dick."

"Six of one..."

"Also you are soaked in blood and you haven't once let go of that duffel bag in the entire ten hours you've been here."

Beat, and in desperate need of my morning cocaine, I opted to concede defeat.

"Yeah, I guess it is totally-"

"Obvious, yes? I am aware of this."

"Ha. Talk to me about obvious. You're pretty well off for a city councelman. Wonder what kind of skeletons you have in your closet."

"In the dog bowls, actually."

"What, not the garde-Wait what about the dog bowls?"

"That is, after they are finely ground in the basement, mixed in with arroz, maiz, some chick peas, perhaps a dash of pepper... You get the idea."

"God damn, dude."

"And if you do not wish to meet the same fate, you will hand the cocaina over to me."

"My nigga. I knew you weren't legit."

"This is Columbia. Who the fuck do you think is?"

"Not me, that's for damn sure."

"Yes, and, clearly not me, either."

"So where does that leave us?"

"You have information about me, I have information on you."

"And enough firearms between us to have every LEO in the city swarming the survivor."

"How you say, slow your roll, amigo. I am not going to kill you."

"Oh yeah, well I- Wait, say what now?"

"Yes, what is wrong with you? I would not kill you."

"You lost me."

"You are family, and since we both have evidence of the other's criminal histories, you will live here, pushing cocaina to wealthy tourists until you feel safe to return to los Estados Unidos."

"And if I refuse?"

"Don't."

The twins entered the room after that, or, just one of them. Not sure which, but he had a bit of coke caked on to the rim of his nostril and he looked lit.

"Ninety-seven percent."

"You are joking?"

"Tested twice." he smirked, tapping the bulb of his nose like a cocky dickhead.

Carlos weighed out a pound and tossed it over to me.

"Have this gone in fourty eight hours."

"How the hell am I supposed to move a pound of cocaine in fourty-eight hours?"

They broke out in laughter.

"Look around you! This is the tourest capitol of Columbia!"

---

The next day they took me to do some shopping, and I learned how to dress more like an arrogant white douchebag. I have to hand it to the twins, though. They know what looks good on me.
I assumed I'd just be walking the beach near the resort, but we stopped in on one of the beachfront restauraunts, really modern place. Obviously, expensive and packed with white people. The one girl who hadn't been bussing tables, as it turned out, was Sofi, whom I failed to recognize at first. See, it had clearly been a while since I'd visited, which was once, when I was like, ten. Back then, Ana Sofia was this annoying brat who, despite being a tight piece of loli derrierre, was still annoying. Now she was seventeen, and I'm still harder than diamonds.

I mean, it's completely disorienting to see that she's a whole different person. She was with some friends, and I guess they didn't recognize me at first, either, but they were pretty flirty off the bat.

"Aye, es guapo, no?"

"Why is it always the handsome ones who are gay?"

"What, is it because of them?" I asked, gesturing nonchalantly to the twins.

"You mean you aren't..."

"No, no. I mean, maybe that one time when I had a bit too much Sangria, but besides, they're my cousins."

They broke out laughing, and Sofia slapped them.

"Cayate, he doesn't know."

"Doesn't know what, now?"

"Cousin marriages are pretty common around here," Alejandro pointed out, pinching my ass as he sat down to my left.

Before I could respond, Daniel snuck up and slapped my ass, before taking a seat to my left.

"Really tightens the family bonds."

They both started making obscene gestures which, as far as hazing goes, not as bad as I was expecting this whole thing to be.

"I'm not gay, I mean, allegedly. Mardi Gras, it's all fuzzy but I'm, like, ninety percent sure I've never done anything gay."

"Hear that, Sofia, he's still available."

"Shh!"

"Right down the hall, too."

"Is this for real? Serious shit, if you're still hazing me, cut it out."

Just then, the waiter brought the drinks, which I downed faster than a dying man in a desert.

"What is the matter with him?"

"Long story."

"Did he at least bring the cocaine?"

I nearly spat my drink.

"You know?"

They laughed.

"You're dressed like a douchebag, wearing sunglasses indoors, and you haven't once let go of your bag since you got here."

"Exact same speech, twenty four hours ago."

"Shut up, and where do we do this? The car? I don't feel like bribing the restroom attendant with my lead pipe."

Before I could react, Sofi had already snuck the coke out and on her second "sample."

"¡Es incredible!"

"Bullshit. Let me."

More snorting, and a surprising amount of rich white people not giving a single solitary fuck at the scene unfolding around them.

I don't know what they were shouting, but I'm pretty sure it meant this was some damn good coke. I was starting to get the idea that this would be easier than expected when some of the other patrons offered to buy some, themselves. Our food had only just arrived before I came to the conclusion that I'm really going to like it here.

I looked around in disbelief.

"Is no one gonna stop this?"

Alejandro chuckled.

"We are in the cocaine capitol of the world."

"Our tourism is primarily wealthy gringos and university students looking to see a little snow when they visit our beaches."

"Oh my god."

"Right?"

"Totally obvious."

"Like your withdrawls."

"What? Oh, yeah. You noticed?"

Sofia cut another line for me, and the last thing I remember before I woke up was the oddly enthusiastic grins of anticipation as they watched me take a nose dive.

---

The blaring alarm clock was bad enough, but I could've done without my throbbing... Head... And a...n...ussss...

I slowly rolled my head to see, yes, Alejandro. Knowing what I'd find, but still in that spacey state of disbelief, I turn the other direction aaaand...

"WHAT THE ACTUAL SHIT-"

"-Are you novinhos doing in my bed?!"

"Wait, no, I'm telling you, I'm not gay, I just blacked out and-"

"Oh, honey, there's nothing to be ashamed of."

"Wh- I-"

"Not you! Them."

"Oh boo."

They bounced back and forth with the teasing, slinking out of bed and down the hall.

"Wait, I don't even... Did they? Did we-"

Before I knew it, Sofia had a finger to my lips.

"You talk too much."

She moved in for a kiss, and holy shit. That electric fucking shock when her tongue pushed past my lips. Depending on who you ask, we made out for either five minutes or half an hour. When she finally broke away, there was some definite afterglow.

"Are you ready for round two?"

---

"Seriously, though-"

"For the last time, nothing happened."

"Not the twins. You."

"Oh?"

"Yes, my god Soph, I can't feel my legs."

"You're complaining about that?"

"Who's complaining?"

"What's there to complain about?"

"Well, as tasty as it was, I wasn't too big on using my tongue to clean the spooge out of your-MOTHERFUCKER! WHAT THE SHIT-" Catching myself, I clear my throat, "...Are you doing in here, Ma'am?"

"Don't mind me, mijo. Desayuno will be waiting when you're ready."

And with that, she began to unfold the laundry, taking her sweet time before heading to the twins' room. Meanwhile my mind drew up blank as I processed the fact that I just watched as the single most awkward moment of my life played out as though nothing was unusual at all.
 
Sofia broke the silence.

"Mind if I shower, first?"

"Please tell me that didn't just happen."

"Que?"

"Your mom! How is she not flipping out?"

Sofia arched an eyebrow, "Seriouso?"

"Right, third world country. Totally forgot."

"You're an ass," Sofia sighed as she went to shower, her thick hips swaying from side to side as she walked away, "but at least you're good in bed."

"Not like I have a choice."

"Not what I meant."

For the first time in ages I got to relax from the stress of being wanted for all those mass murders I committed.

... And that was when I got the call.


Chapter Two - Foreign Policy


"Are you sure?"

I nodded.

"Two hundred kilos. Cash up front."

Alejandro and Daniel exchanged worried glances.

"We've never moved that much before."

"At least, not at once."

I shrugged.

"I have, it's real easy."

"How do you figure?"

"Go in, get the money-"

Sophie shook her head.

"No, this could easily be a cartel trap."

"What, no, li-"

"Sophia is right," Daniel interrupted, "A first time buyer paying up front for that much?"

"Look, if you would just hear me out-"

Alejandro agreed.

"It could even be la policia."

I whistled loudly.

"Oye!"

"Puto!"

"Bastardo!"

Ignoring their insults, I went on.

"Even if it's the cartel or the cops or whatever, we still stand to gain a lot here."

They all exchanged confused glances.

"Look, obviously you guys have a lot of guns, right?"

"Si, and grenades as well."

"Perfect! So even if it's not a trap, we go in, shoot up the place and take back the cocaine and the money."

"You are joking, no?"

I put on the most serious look I could muster.

"I never joke about armed robbery."

"I don't know, pissing off the cartel is a big mistake."

"Agreed, we rely on them."

I raised an eyebrow.

"For what?"

"Seriouso?"

"Oh, right. Your dad's a politician."

"So obviously we can't pass up an opportunity like this, pero..."

Suddenly, I got an idea.

"What if we became the cartel."

They all burst out laughing.

"No, seriously, we need a plan."

"I am serious!" I exclaimed, a little taken aback, "How hard could it be?"

"The cartel are in charge of the police force, the military, and the entire drug trafficking scene here."

"Picking a fight with them is like asking for a bullet in the head."

"What if we killed their leader?"

Sophie smacked me upside the head.

"This isn't the highlander, you can't just kill the head of the entire cartel and expect them to bow down to you."

"Why? Has anyone ever tried it before?"

They were stumped.

"Well, no, pero-"

"So what's the big deal?"

"You mean aside from the fact that it would be suicide?"

"You don't know until you try."

"What kind of insane logic is that?"

I smiled menacingly, holding up my knife.

"The fun kind."

---

I stared down the face of death itself. Splinters of wood flying past my head as the table gave way to heavy artiliary fire. Thinking fast, I pulled out a grenade, kissing it once for luck before I tossed it over my shoulder.
Or, at least, that's how I imagined things would go. But it turned out that killing the head of the cartel was way easier than I thought. I mean, I was so high I don't remember how we even pulled it off, so it seems pretty anti-climactic in retrospect, but I did get some serious stabbing done, judging by all the blood stains on my knife and clothes.

Aljeandro was dumbfounded.

"I can't believe it worked."

Daniel was equally suprised.

"I can't believe they just surrendered."

"What did you expect?" I asked, "We just killed their leader."

Sophie held up a blood stained cell phone.

"And also their successors."

"Right? Hey how did we pull it off, anyway?"

"Seriouso?"

"Cocaine makes me black out."

"Well..."

---

Hours earlier...

"So this is what we do. At three in the morning, we drive to their appartment to make the deal, killing any hired thugs in the process. Then we torture the HNIC until he gives us the location of his superior. We keep following the chain of command until we find out where the head of the cartel lives. Once we find his estate, Sophie, you cut the feed to the cameras while Alejandro and Daniel use these silencers to take out any patrols on the property. Once security is neutralized, I'll create a diversion using some gasoline and this book of matches I got from a strip club. Then we storm the compound killing every last mofo in sight."

"What happens when their successors show up with reinforcements?"

"Good question. They don't."

"Que?"

"Or, at least, not with reinforcements. See, we'll hold the head of the cartel at gunpoint, having him call each of his next in command up to the estate where we will be waiting to ambush them with a series of hastily constructed traps."

"That has to be hands down the most ridiculous-"

---

Hours later...

"Still can't believe we pulled that off."

I did a line of coke.

"Never underestimate the things you can do when you're coked up."

Sophie shook her head.

"Fine, you were right."

Alejandro began,

"So, now that you're the head of the cartel..."

"What's our first order of business?" Daniel finished, "Aside from getting high, I mean."

"Well," I grinned deviously, "Whatever the fuck we want."


Chapter Three - Playing Politics


The manager of the First National Bank of Columbia slammed a fist down on his desk.

"This is an outrage! You can't just demand all of our money like this."

"Well, you say that..."

I motioned to the cartel gunmen behind me.

"You won't get away with this!"

I laughed as I repeated myself, adding extra sarcasm for sentence seasoning.

"Well, _you say that!_

"La policia will show up any second to have you executed you little shit!"

"Funny story..." Alejandro explained, "See, we kind of are the police now."

Daniel elaborated on that.

"To the extent that we killed the real police and nobody argues with our guns."

"This- This is an outrage!"

"No," I corrected him, cocking my .45, "This is a robbery."

---

"Remind me again," Sophie demanded, pinching the bridge of her nose, "What good did this do us?"

"See, by robbing half of the city blind, we create widespread fear in the other half."

"Which we use to charge the other half for our protection racket," Alejandro explained, "And then we switch out every week or so."

Sofi was dumbfounded,

"This is insane!"

"No," I corrected her, "What's insane is the great deal I got on these five white tigers."

I patted the top of the cramped, rusted iron cage. From inside, an unseen jungle cat roared.

"And if we want to stay in the black after that ludicrous impulse buy," Alejandro continued, "We'll basically have to take over a whole other cartel."

"Exactly," Daniel added, "because you would not believe how much it's costing us to feed them."

I put on an annoying grin, slid up to Sophie, and ribbed her with my elbow.

"And what are the chances of us pulling _that_ off, again?"

Sophie sighed in defeat.
"AYe dios mio."

---

Sophia pulled the car around, and we loaded the blood-soaked duffel bags into the trunk. We spent the ride home in relative silence, taking in the fact that we siezed control over most of the cocaine trade in Columbia in the space of a night.

"You didn't have to shoot him, you know."

"Who," I asked, "The blind old janitor?"

Alejandro rolled his eyes.

"Any of them."

"Look," I explained, "Blind people are dangerous."

"To who?!"

"_Whom._" I corrected Alejandro.

"To nobody," Sophie growled, "Because you sociopaths killed everyone in there!"

"Exactly!" I piped up, "Which is what he would have done with his Daredevil blind-guy judo powers!"

"You really are loco!"

I snorted a line.

"What's loco is how pure this stuff is. Come on, smell it. What are you, chicken?"

Sophie slammed the brakes, sending the silver platter flying onto the dashboard as we all shouted angrily and confused. There was a brief moment of silence, save for the sound of the platter spinning on it's edge faster and faster until it came to rest after an awkward and tense few seconds.

"I'm sorry," Sophie smirked, "I'm a what?"

"COCK!" I shouted, rubbing a bright red spot from where my forehead made contact with the seat in front of me.

"And you're an ass." Daniel groaned, his glasses split in two from the impact.

"How bout you buddy?" I piped up, back to my old self, "You holding up?"

Alejandro, who I guess had a thing about abrupt stops, had puked a little into his lap and was hunched over. In place of a response he gave me the finger.

Sophie turned towards me and tried to get us back on topic.
"Where to next?"

"I think it's time we paid the President a little visit..."

---

Carlos shot out of bed when he heard the confetti cannon go off. Looking around, he saw the four of us around his bed. Then he saw the banner.

"What is the meaning of this?"

"Suprise, you're the new President of Colombia!"

He was dumbfounded, "I am? How?"

"Because, papi," Sophia explained, "We killed the old one."

"Idiotos! The cartel will have my head! And the police would never allow it!"

"Calm down," I assured him, "None of those people are coming after you."

"Of course they are!" He cried out as he hopped out of bed, "El Presidente was their biggest political advocate! Killing him is a death sentence!"

"Well, see, about that..." Alejandro began.

"We kind of are the cartel now." Daniel explained.

Carlos's jaw dropped.

"Y... Y la policia?"

"All taken care of," Sofia smiled, "We're in control of the authorities, as well."

"In what possible way?"

I laughed.

"Because they can't arrest us now that they're dead."

"And you did all this in a single night?"

Sofia nodded.

"You wouldn't believe how easy it was."

"Even I don't believe it, and I was there."

"Ditto."

"So Mr. Mayor," I mused, "What's your first order of business?"

Carlos stood at the window, looking out into the sunrise as a streak of gold washed over him.

"To take over the world."


Chapter Four - Problem Child


Somewhere deep in the jungles of Thailand...

A balding, gun-weilding stooge slammed a brick of cocaine down onto the desk as a small child with a fierce temper leered up at him.

"What the fuck is this?"

"Our latest shipment, sir."

"THIS?" He spat, "This is hardly even a pound!"

"We have been had, it would seem."

"Get me the head of the columbian cartel!"

"About that, sir, it would seem they're under new management."

"How do you know?"

"It was what I was told when I called him."

"Then bring me the head of the new cartel leader!"

"Like, the actual head, or..."

"It's a figure of speach, moron!"

"Oh, right away, sir!"

---

We woke up that night unsure of what we were hearing. It sounded like a mix between a scream and gunshots. Bursting into his room, we feared for the worst. What we saw was only marginally worse. There, like a sleeping walrus, Carlos lie riddled with bullet holes. A knife sticking out of a single brick of coke. Pierced through that coke knife was a note.

And I knew what needed to be done.

---

"You can't go to Thailand!"

I slammed the trunk down.

"I sure as shit can."

"Esta loca!"

"No, Sofia," I glared at her, "What's loca is the fact that I listened when you idiots-"

I pointed towards Alejandro and Daniel.

"-Told me nothing could possibly go wrong."

"What? I thought we could save money by diverting product away from Thailand."

"Plus, cutting the costs of delivery with that drone was brilliant."

"Yeah, no it isn't," I insisted, "That drone cost us 2.8 mil!"

"Eh, it's a long term sort of savings."

"Yeah, it'll pay off."
-
"You know, eventually."

"It'd better," I growled, "Now if you'll excuse me, I have to kick some dumb kid's teeth in."

"You are serious?" Sophie demanded, "The Jade Dragons are like the mafia times twelve!"

"Their gunmen are more ruthless individually than the entire cartel-"

"Our cartel!" I reminded him.

"-Than OUR cartel as a whole."

I locked and loaded.

"Exactly why we need to gain control."

Sofia got in the car.

"I'm going with you. No one kills my father and gets away with it."

"Count me in."

"Ditto."

I shook my head.

"Someone needs to stay behind and run the cartel." I explained, "And since this might take a few days, you two stay here."

"Why do we have to stay?" Alejandro and Daniel piped up in unison, "You'll need all the help you can get!"

"That's true," I agreed, "Granted, I'll give you that much, but you're both hella gay and I'd feel a little better about sleeping in the jungle if I wasn't worried you two would go all brokeback mountain on me."

"Do you know how insulting that was?"

"Nope." I answered as I started the car, "and I don't care either."

Speeding off, I kicked up a cloud of dust in the twins' faces.

"Bastardo!" Alejandro said between coughs.

"Good riddance, I say." Daniel agreed.

---

"Did a reptilian ship just..."

"No yeah it definitely just left."

"For what?" Kid demanded, "Did they find him?"

"No," I correccted her, sepping out of the thick underbrush onto the cliff overlooking the massive fantasy city of Nome, home of the Gnomes, "And seeing as how we're not in Kansas aymore..."

"The fuck are you on ab-" Kid began as she stepped out with me, "Oh."

"Yeah."

"Oh fuck."

Chapter Three - No Place Like (g)Nome

First I should clarify we definitely weren't high and this definitely wasn't Kansas anymore.

Actually that's a lie. We were very high and we've never been to Kansas.

But we were definitely not tripping. And as we approached the cobblestone streets the sight of all the bearded midgets made me realize one thing:

We're pretty much gods to them.

So with that in mind you can probably guess what Kid and I did to take over the bizarre parallel fantasy world we apparently stumbled into. And we did it in record time because a world of smurfs and elves is a world of swords and magic and a world of smurfs and magic doesn't hold up to guns and shit.

---

"You'll never get away with it!" The (former) Gnomish Emporor griped, "You're too darn tall!"

"That's a damn lie!" I shouted as I pointed a gun at the manservant attending to my feet, "the gnomes love me, don't you Short Run?"

"Y-Yes sir." Short Run stammered in fear, "Also my name is-"

"Shut the fuck up, Short Run!" Kid shouted at him angrily.

---

"Sir, the Taliban is invading!"

I looked up from eating my little sister's ass and pulled off my gimp hood. "The what?"

"The Taliban!"

"... As in the Afghani Taliban?"

"Where the fuck did you think you were?"

"... Noooooot in a rural afghani villaige populated by terrified pygmies?"

"That does explain the hummus." Kid mused, pulling her hot pink ball-gag off.

---

The sun beat down on the mud hut roofings of the rural afghani villaige, so rural in fact that it didn't even have a gun market (which really would have come in handy for what was about to happen to these poor
schmucks). Kid and I considered abandoning ship, but then I remembered 9/11 and how funny it was. After that we decided to just fuck it and bail on these midges.

So we get to Kabul and as expected those dudes don't even bother to check if we're terrorists they just let us on the plane. And after getting back stateside we made our first order of business to get just absolutely
fucked up.

---

Step number one when waking up on a cold floor with no idea where you are and how you got there is to check your surroundings for people. I found three. One was alive, but unconscious, and the rest were the previous occupants of the house my little sister and I had apparently broken into in what I can only surmise was a drug-and-alcohol-induced black out. Now, you might then look for your phone and call the police. Two problems with that - someone was already calling me and evidently I would have to visit the hospital at a later point in time to get an object removed from my colon. Punching my abdomen I heard the phone connect and a (very muffled) voice on the other end of the line.

"This is the Bulldog." The modulated voice on the other end of the line growled, "Are they dead yet?"

"Uh... Yes?"

"Where are you?" The voice demanded, "It sounds wet."

"I'm going through a colon!" I explained half paying attention, "I mean tunnel."

"Regardless, we have another job for you."

"Cooooool." I trailed off, "Just one question."

"No questions."

"K."

"I'm sending the address." The voice growled, "The mark is six one, bald, and knows you're coming."

"What," I joked, "Is it mr Clean?"

"... Just get the job done."

Click.

The coordinates I got in a text a few minutes later, but with no way to read it I had to borrow the dead guy's cell to call the one person who could help me figure out who I just agreed to murder.

"Madam Whorina Thotiana's Gypsie Psychic Emporium and Notary Public, this is Madam Whorina Thotiana speaking. How can I help you, Ace?"

"Damn you're good."

"I know dahling, I'm a psychic."

"Do you know wh-"

"Mister Clean."

"I fucking knew it!" I shouted, hanging up immediately before she could slap me with charges.

---

According to I.N.T.E.L., Mr. Clean was on the 69th floor of the Nabisco Tower in Dubai, which was currently under the control of the Siberian branch of Z-Corp. That meant we couldn't just bust in the way we normally did. We'd have to hijack a cargo plane and HALO in overhead. But to do that we'd need a B-team to cut the power to the whole city. Luckily, for us, Guatemalan ISIS was more than happy to stage a terror attack on the power plant to lure the military to their coordinates. That left the simple matter of killing mr Clean to Kid and I. And thanks to our efforts in Caracas we had clearly dealt a financial blow to Z-corp, who could only afford two easily overwhelmed guards to patrol the massive skyscraper rooftop.


"Son of a bitch." Kid scoffed, "You knew."

"You think I'd just let you play dirty?" he growled, "I'm mister fucking Clean."

He whapped her across the back of the head and from then on out it was up to me to rescue my little sister. Again.

---

"Kid Courageous." Mister Clean began his monologue pacing my little sister, "So we meet again?"

"Bitch I'm twelve." Kid laughed, "Were you lurking around my middle school or something?"

"You don't remember?" He chuckled darkly, "From Caracas?"

"Oh shit."

---

Several weeks ago at Z-Corp HQ...


"Please wait!" The last of the nazi stormtroopers insisted, "You killed our leader that means you're the oberfuhrers now!"

We both turned to face him.

"Why the fuck would we want that?"

"Oh, balls."


---


"You were the guy we shot?"


"Yes."


"That's retarded." Kid reasoned, "It was a headshot."


"I'm a cyborg now."


"Oh that reminds me, we need to cut this short."


"Why the hell would we do that?"


"Because I'm about to be rescued."


"Oh please," Mr. Clean roared with laughter, "Who could possibly get past me?"


"I mean..."


"I'm fucking BIONIC." Mr Clean bragged, "It'd take a better, more futuristic cyborg to-"


All of a sudden I used the full extent of my cybernetic augmentations to burst through the door and tackle Kid clean out the window of the 69th floor of Z-Corp's Dubai branch (nice).


"Took you long enough!" Kid shouted as I pulled the ripcord on the parachute.


"Wow, okay." I scoffed, "So just drop you right here or?"


She pulled a gun on me.
"Try me bitch."


"Rescinded."


"That's what I thought."
